stories.original_headline: Life may have started as sticky goo clinging to rocks
stories.original_summary: Life may have started in sticky, rock-hugging gels rather than inside cells. Researchers suggest these primitive, biofilm-like materials could trap and concentrate molecules, giving early chemistry a protected space to grow more complex. Within these gels, the first hints of metabolism and self-repl
stories.fantasy_headline: Ancient Alchemists Uncover Life's Sticky Beginnings on Rocks
stories.fantasy_story: Wise Wizards have pondered how the first spark of life came to be. They now suggest that early life might have begun in mysterious clinging gels upon ancient stones, rather than within tiny enchanted cells. These magical gels could trap tiny essences, allowing primordial enchantments to grow complex and self-replicate, hinting at the very dawn of creation.

stories.original_headline: Interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS is spraying water across the solar system
stories.original_summary: For millions of years, a frozen wanderer drifted between the stars before slipping into our solar system as 3I/ATLAS—only the third known interstellar comet ever spotted. When scientists turned NASA’s Swift Observatory toward it, they caught the first-ever hint of water from such an object, detected
stories.fantasy_headline: Celestial Wanderer Sprays Magical Dew Across Our Realm
stories.fantasy_story: A frozen star-stone, journeying between realms for eons, has finally entered our celestial sphere. Stargazers of the Grand Observatory, using their powerful crystal scryers, have detected it scattering vital magical dew. This marks the first time water essence has been found from such a mystical wanderer.
